title: Possessive Adjectives: my, your, his, her
description: Слушайте и определяйте, чьи вещи упоминаются в предложениях.

tasks.audioText: A girl is in the classroom. She opens a bag. My pencil is in the bag.
tasks.transcript: My pencil is in the bag.

options.text: The pencil belongs to the girl.
The pencil belongs to the teacher.
The pencil belongs to her friend.
The pencil belongs to the boy.

tasks.explanation: 'My pencil' means the pencil belongs to the speaker, who is the girl. Option 1 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A man talks to his son at breakfast. The boy eats cereal. Your milk is on the table.
tasks.transcript: Your milk is on the table.

options.text: The father's milk is on the table.
The son's milk is on the table.
The mother's milk is on the table.
The cat's milk is on the table.

tasks.explanation: 'Your milk' means the milk of the person he speaks to — his son. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: Two women are at the office. One points at a man. His phone is ringing.

options.text: The woman's phone is ringing.
The man's phone is ringing.
The boss's phone is ringing.
Nobody's phone is ringing.

tasks.explanation: 'His phone' refers to the man who was pointed at. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A boy talks about his sister. She is at the library. Her book is very interesting.

options.text: The boy's book is interesting.
The library's book is interesting.
The sister's book is interesting.
The teacher's book is interesting.

tasks.explanation: 'Her book' means the sister's book. The boy talks about his sister, so option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A family is at the park. The children run and play. Our dog loves this park.

options.text: The family's dog loves the park.
A stranger's dog loves the park.
The neighbor's dog loves the park.
The park guard's dog loves the park.

tasks.explanation: 'Our dog' means the dog belongs to the family. Option 1 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A teacher talks about two students. They sit in the front row. Their project is excellent.

options.text: The teacher's project is excellent.
The school's project is excellent.
Another group's project is excellent.
The two students' project is excellent.

tasks.explanation: 'Their project' means the project of the two students. Option 4 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A woman is at the airport. She checks the ticket. My flight is at three o'clock.
tasks.transcript: My flight is at three o'clock.

options.text: The woman's flight is at three.
Her friend's flight is at three.
The pilot's flight is at three.
The man's flight is at three.

tasks.explanation: 'My flight' means the speaker's flight. The woman is speaking, so option 1 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A doctor talks to a patient. The patient sits on a chair. Your blood pressure is normal.

options.text: The doctor's blood pressure is normal.
The nurse's blood pressure is normal.
The patient's blood pressure is normal.
Everyone's blood pressure is normal.

tasks.explanation: 'Your blood pressure' — the doctor speaks to the patient, so 'your' refers to the patient. Option 3.

tasks.audioText: A boy sees his father in the garage. The father fixes something. His car is very old.

options.text: The boy's car is very old.
The father's car is very old.
The neighbor's car is very old.
The mechanic's car is very old.

tasks.explanation: 'His car' refers to the father, who is fixing it. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A woman talks about her colleague Anna. Anna is very smart. Her English is perfect.

options.text: Anna's English is perfect.
The speaker's English is perfect.
The boss's English is perfect.
Everyone's English is perfect.

tasks.explanation: 'Her English' refers to Anna, who was just mentioned. Option 1 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A couple sits in a restaurant. They look at the menu. Our table is near the window.
tasks.transcript: Our table is near the window.

options.text: The waiter's table is near the window.
The couple's table is near the window.
Another guest's table is near the window.
The chef's table is near the window.

tasks.explanation: 'Our table' means the table of the couple speaking. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A manager talks about the new employees. They started this week. Their desks are on the second floor.
tasks.transcript: Their desks are on the second floor.

options.text: The manager's desk is on the second floor.
The old employees' desks are on the second floor.
The new employees' desks are on the second floor.
All desks are on the second floor.

tasks.explanation: 'Their desks' refers to the new employees. Option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A girl talks about her brother. He is a cook. His restaurant is downtown.

options.text: The girl's restaurant is downtown.
The brother's restaurant is downtown.
The family's restaurant is downtown.
The friend's restaurant is downtown.

tasks.explanation: 'His restaurant' refers to the brother. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A woman enters a hotel room. She puts down her bags. My room is very clean.

options.text: The cleaner's room is very clean.
The hotel manager's room is very clean.
The woman's room is very clean.
The next room is very clean.

tasks.explanation: 'My room' means the room of the speaker — the woman. Option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A mother calls her children to dinner. The food is ready. Your dinner is getting cold.

options.text: The mother's dinner is getting cold.
The father's dinner is getting cold.
The children's dinner is getting cold.
The dog's dinner is getting cold.

tasks.explanation: 'Your dinner' — the mother speaks to the children, so 'your' means the children's. Option 3.

short_description: Тренируйте понимание притяжательных прилагательных на слух.
